posts.title: If
posts.markdown:
IF you can keep your head when all about you 
Are losing theirs and blaming it on you,
If you can trust yourself when all men doubt you,
But make allowance for their doubting too;
If you can wait and not be tired by waiting,
Or being lied about, don't deal in lies,
Or being hated, don't give way to hating,
And yet don't look too good, nor talk too wise:

If you can dream - and not make dreams your master;
If you can think - and not make thoughts your aim;
If you can meet with Triumph and Disaster
And treat those two impostors just the same;
If you can bear to hear the truth you've spoken
Twisted by knaves to make a trap for fools,
Or watch the things you gave your life to, broken,
And stoop and build 'em up with worn-out tools: 

If you can make one heap of all your winnings 
And risk it on one turn of pitch-and-toss,
And lose, and start again at your beginnings
And never breathe a word about your loss;
If you can force your heart and nerve and sinew
To serve your turn long after they are gone,
And so hold on when there is nothing in you
Except the Will which says to them: 'Hold on!'

If you can talk with crowds and keep your virtue,
' Or walk with Kings - nor lose the common touch,
if neither foes nor loving friends can hurt you,
If all men count with you, but none too much;
If you can fill the unforgiving minute
With sixty seconds' worth of distance run,
Yours is the Earth and everything that's in it,
And - which is more - you'll be a Man, my son!

-Rudyard Kipling
posts.html:
IF you can keep your head when all about you
Are losing theirs and blaming it on you,
If you can trust yourself when all men doubt you,
But make allowance for their doubting too;
If you can wait and not be tired by waiting,
Or being lied about, don't deal in lies,
Or being hated, don't give way to hating,
And yet don't look too good, nor talk too wise:

If you can dream - and not make dreams your master;
If you can think - and not make thoughts your aim;
If you can meet with Triumph and Disaster
And treat those two impostors just the same;
If you can bear to hear the truth you've spoken
Twisted by knaves to make a trap for fools,
Or watch the things you gave your life to, broken,
And stoop and build 'em up with worn-out tools:

If you can make one heap of all your winnings
And risk it on one turn of pitch-and-toss,
And lose, and start again at your beginnings
And never breathe a word about your loss;
If you can force your heart and nerve and sinew
To serve your turn long after they are gone,
And so hold on when there is nothing in you
Except the Will which says to them: 'Hold on!'

If you can talk with crowds and keep your virtue,
' Or walk with Kings - nor lose the common touch,
if neither foes nor loving friends can hurt you,
If all men count with you, but none too much;
If you can fill the unforgiving minute
With sixty seconds' worth of distance run,
Yours is the Earth and everything that's in it,
And - which is more - you'll be a Man, my son!

-Rudyard Kipling

posts.title: But you belong to me
posts.markdown:
<iframe width="560" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/Bpu0TIXzI1w" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

I know (I know) you belong
To somebody new
But tonight
You belong to me

Although (although) we're apart
You are a part of my heart
But tonight
You belong to me

Wait down by the stream 
How sweet it will seem
Once more just to dream in 
The moonlight
My honey I know
With the dawn 
That you will be gone
But tonight 
You belong to me

But tonight 
You belong
To me

-Billy Rose
posts.html:
I know (I know) you belong
To somebody new
But tonight
You belong to me

Although (although) we're apart
You are a part of my heart
But tonight
You belong to me

Wait down by the stream
How sweet it will seem
Once more just to dream in
The moonlight
My honey I know
With the dawn
That you will be gone
But tonight
You belong to me

But tonight
You belong
To me

-Billy Rose

posts.title: Miner Introduction
posts.markdown:
##Mining data in a minute Data = anything = everything. Data defines you.
Limbs Color CommonSense Weight Species
4 white yes 150 Human
2 white no 20 Bird
8 black no 0.50 Spider
Data also defines projects.
SLOC acap Complexity Reliability
 Cost
1000 very high
 nominal high 250
100 low high high 75
2000000
 nominal low low 1000
* SLOC, acap, Complexity, Reliability are taken from COCOMO attributes. Check Dr. Barry Boehm's [model](http://csse.usc.edu/csse/research/COCOMOII/cocomo2000.0/CII_modelman2000.0.pdf) definitions to define model attributes for your project. ### Data just tables of information? No, data = anything. The things that you see can be mined, words you hear can be mined, food you eat can be mined, the feelings you feel can be mined!! ### What is mining? From [Wiki](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_mining), ~~Data mining (the analysis step of the "Knowledge Discovery in Databases" process, or KDD), an interdisciplinary subfield of computer science, is the computational process of discovering patterns in large data sets involving methods at the intersection of artificial intelligence, machine learning, statistics, and database systems.~~ Thats simple definition. Lets make it even more simple. When you see an orange: ![](http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/f/f9/Orange_and_cross_section.jpg) #### How do you know its an orange? Well, I first see the color of object: **Color** Then, I smell it: **Odour** Then, I taste it: **Taste** This gives me information about what object I have. Then I will compare it with the things I saw/smelled/ate before and make a decision if it is an orange. *Making a machine do the same is data mining.* #### How can we make a machine *know* that its an orange? A machine can be made to think ~~just~~ almost like us. It takes three parts to ***know*** something: 1. Have information. 2. Process information 3. Decide on that information Which is shown in almost every data mining tutorial: ![](http://recommender-systems.readthedocs.org/en/latest/_images/Kdd-process.png) * Having information = Having **Color**, **Odour**, **Taste** = Selection, Preprocessing. * Process information = Comparing with previous eatables = Feature selection and extraction, *Data mining* * Deciding = deciding it is an orange = Interpretation and Evaluation Since, **Color**, **Odour**, **Taste** help model decide which fruit the object is, they are the attributes of model, also called ***independent*** variables. As we are predicting for name of fruit, *Name of fruit* is the ***dependent*** variable, which changes according to independent variables. ### Example Now, if we understand what mining is. Lets try to mine something.
color taste fruitname
red sweet apple
yellow sweet banana
orange sour orange
red
 sour strawberry
Now if you are only given: * Color: red Your model predicts that it could be an apple or strawberry. ### Further Reading For more detailed information, check [here](http://menzies.us/cs573/)
posts.html:
Mining data in a minute

Data = anything = everything.

Data defines you.

Limbs Color CommonSense Weight Species
4 white yes 150 Human
2 white no 20 Bird
8 black no 0.50 Spider

Data also defines projects.

SLOC acap Complexity Reliability
 Cost
1000 very high
 nominal high 250
100 low high high 75
2000000
 nominal low low 1000
  • SLOC, acap, Complexity, Reliability are taken from COCOMO attributes. Check Dr. Barry Boehm's model definitions to define model attributes for your project.

Data just tables of information?

No, data = anything. The things that you see can be mined, words you hear can be mined, food you eat can be mined, the feelings you feel can be mined!!

What is mining?

From Wiki, Data mining (the analysis step of the "Knowledge Discovery in Databases" process, or KDD), an interdisciplinary subfield of computer science, is the computational process of discovering patterns in large data sets involving methods at the intersection of artificial intelligence, machine learning, statistics, and database systems.

Thats simple definition. Lets make it even more simple.

When you see an orange:

How do you know its an orange?

Well, I first see the color of object: Color
Then, I smell it: Odour
Then, I taste it: Taste
This gives me information about what object I have.

Then I will compare it with the things I saw/smelled/ate before and make a decision if it is an orange. Making a machine do the same is data mining.

How can we make a machine know that its an orange?

A machine can be made to think just almost like us.

It takes three parts to know something:

  1. Have information.
  2. Process information
  3. Decide on that information

Which is shown in almost every data mining tutorial:

  • Having information = Having Color, Odour, Taste = Selection, Preprocessing.
  • Process information = Comparing with previous eatables = Feature selection and extraction, Data mining
  • Deciding = deciding it is an orange = Interpretation and Evaluation

Since, Color, Odour, Taste help model decide which fruit the object is, they are the attributes of model, also called independent variables.

As we are predicting for name of fruit, Name of fruit is the dependent variable, which changes according to independent variables.

Example

Now, if we understand what mining is. Lets try to mine something.

color taste fruitname
red sweet apple
yellow sweet banana
orange sour orange
red
 sour strawberry

Now if you are only given:

  • Color: red

Your model predicts that it could be an apple or strawberry.

Further Reading

For more detailed information, check here
